systemPrompt: Browser extension for fuzzy search across bookmarks, history, and tabs. Privacy-focused with no external communication. See CLAUDE.md and AGENTS.md for full details.

testing.beforeCommit: npm run lint && npm run test && npm run test:e2e

rules: Follow the verify loop: npm run lint → npm run test → npm run test:e2e
Use /verify slash command before commits and PRs
NEVER edit .bundle.min.js files - edit source in popup/js/ instead
All source uses ES modules, Jest runs with --experimental-vm-modules
Prefer editing existing files over creating new files
Search flow: Query Parsing → Search Execution → Scoring (5-step) → Rendering
Entry points in popup/js/init*.js bundle to .bundle.min.js via bin/bundle.js
Module organization: helper/ (utils), model/ (data), search/ (algorithms), view/ (UI)
Use ext global object for app state (opts, model, dom, initialized, searchCache)
Tags use #tag syntax, folders use ~folder syntax for search filtering
Consider cross-platform compatibility (Chrome/Firefox/Edge with Manifest V3)
Run 'npm run watch' during extension development for auto-rebuild
Use popup/mockData/ fixtures with 'npm run start' for local testing
Clear searchCache when modifying scoring logic in popup/js/search/scoring.js
